author: ehu
msg: Fix issue #2826 (Conflicting prop update reported as 'U'pdate).
(Also start taking a stab at making prop-merging more robust.)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/props.c
(set_prop_merge_state): New.  Determines whether the state needs updating,
because the new value has a higher priority of being reported.
(apply_single_prop_add,
apply_single_prop_delete,
apply_single_prop_change): Factored out of svn_wc__merge_props().
(svn_wc__merge_props): Except for initialization, set value of 'state'
through set_prop_merge_state().  Adjust to call factored out functions.
* tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(simple_property_merges): If we expect a property conflict,
we also expect it to be reported.  Adjust expected_output.
(avoid_reflected_revs): Change the expected mergeinfo prop
to what we actually should expect.

author: kfogel
msg: * tools/dev/contribulyze.py
(process_committers): Ignore dormant committers; that is, treat them
like full committers, which they are.
Without this change, Branko Čibej's name (for example) shows up in
contribulyzer output, and that's just a distraction for our purposes.

author: sage
msg: Add a info method and helper functions to the python ctypes WC class. Wraps all
the functionality needed to allow the user to get info on the wc through callbacks
to a user defined function.
* (csvn/wc.py):
(__init__): Add initalization code to setup info callbacks.
(_info_wrapper): Internal method to wrap a call to the user provided info
function.
(set_info_func): New method to allow the user to set the info callback without
invoking the info method. Also used internally by the info method.
(info): Method to get information on the working copy using a callback.

author: sage
msg: Add a propget method to the python ctypes WC class. Allows the user to get the
value of a prop for a given target (which may be a directory, in which case the
operation can recurse). Works as a wrapper for svn_client_propget2.
* (csvn/wc.py):
(propget): New method to get property values for the working copy.

author: sage
msg: Add a checkout method to the python ctypes WC class. The checkout method checks
out a new working copy, placing it in the working copy as specified by the user.
Essentially works as a wrapper for svn_client_checkout2.
* (csvn/wc.py):
(checkout): New method to checkout a working copy from a repository.
